bug.author: zidanexu
bug.summary: map result is different with given data
bug.description: hi , I. run the default command " python train.py --weights '' --device='4,5,6,7' . datasets used is coco2017. Is the test result is normal? ( eg. the 0.5map is 0.416, lower than 43.2) : <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54395639/83962896-0a720880-a8d4-11ea-94f7-480ddc68a83e.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zidanexu>@zidanexu</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb>Google Colab Notebook</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>GCP Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom model or data training question, please note that Ultralytics does not provide free personal support. As a leader in vision ML and AI, we do offer professional consulting, from simple expert advice up to delivery of fully customized, end-to-end production solutions for our clients, such as:
Cloud-based AI surveillance systems operating on hundreds of HD video streams in realtime. Edge AI integrated into custom iOS and Android apps for realtime 30 FPS video inference. Custom data training, hyperparameter evolution, and model exportation to any destination.
For more information please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zidanexu>@zidanexu</denchmark-link> readme mAPs are run at . I would also recommend our new repo for higher mAP and better reproducibility. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5>https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5</denchmark-link>
